name: Grilled Vegetable Skewers
steps: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Cut zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion into bite-sized pieces. Leave mushrooms whole if small or halve if large.
Thread the vegetables onto skewers, alternating types for color and variety.
Brush the skewers with olive oil and season with herbs, salt, and pepper.
Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and lightly charred.
Serve immediately.

name: Caprese Salad
steps: Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella into even rounds.
Layer the tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating with fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper, then serve immediately.

name: Watermelon Feta Salad
steps: Cut the watermelon into bite-sized cubes and place in a large bowl.
Crumble feta cheese over the watermelon.
Add chopped fresh mint and drizzle with olive oil and a squeeze of lime juice.
Toss gently and serve chilled.

name: Grilled Shrimp Tacos
steps: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat and skewer the shrimp.
Brush the shrimp with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lime juice.
Grill the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side, until cooked through.
Warm the taco shells and fill with grilled shrimp, shredded cabbage, diced avocado, and fresh cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges.

name: Peach Iced Tea
steps: Peel and slice peaches, then puree them in a blender until smooth.
Brew black tea and let it cool to room temperature.
In a large pitcher, combine the tea, peach puree, and sugar to taste. Stir well.
Serve over ice and garnish with peach slices.
